name: HD 12661
scenarioDescription:
The HD 12661 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 12661 is a star with 1.2 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.2 times its radius. It is located 123.58 light years away from the solar system.

HD 12661 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 12661 system


HD 12661 b

HD 12661 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.84 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 12661 b is 772.74 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 12661 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 12661 c

HD 12661 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.81 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 12661 c is 576.216 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 12661 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 12661, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
